author: Stalkingwolf

text:
Oh, interesting! I've heard a ton of good things about this game. I just got Chrono Trigger DS last christmas and I love it, but now, I'm definately after Legend of Grimrock. Especially after all the good things I've heard about it, for example, ProJared put it in the #1 spot on his GOTY list. 
If you're putting this just at #5, I'm really curious to see what your other 5 are going to be.
author: Jirt

text: Great thing about this song is that it has a very clear melody.  Makes me wanna track down the sheet music and convert it to my instrument.
author: WhiteTigerShiro

text: Loved Grimrock.  I think the only real con is that there's no random dungeon option.  I think they could have easily included the option for randomized dungeons, and the only thing they'd have had to have given up is the secret areas, which would be a minor loss in comparison.
author: WhiteTigerShiro

text: I don't think you've played many old school dungeon crawlers.  Grimrock is great, don't get me wrong, but it's fairly shallow compared to older games of its ilk.
author: WhiteTigerShiro

text: It's pretty close. It doesn't have as many races/classes but it's plenty deep enough compared to the old school dungeon crawlers. It's also has a pretty good dungeon editor with an active community and quite a few custom dungeons out there already. Someones even working on an Eye of the Beholder remake. I'd highly recommend it if you like first person dungeon crawlers.
author: 1991jiub

text: There is a default party you can use, but you can make a custom party, choosing combinations of race and class. As characters level up, you can spend points in various proficiencies depending on their class. It's a pretty good game.
author: TheNoblePirate

text: LoG is awesome. Such a satisfying gaming experience. Start it on Hard if you dare.
author: Mortyee

text: yeah i did, but the one thing i cant really tell is character creation/progression. Is there even creation? In all the videos, everyone was using the same characters
author: Gorilla Games

text: I haven't played Eye of the Beholder, but since it's a dungeon crawler it's probably pretty similar. It took me about 15 hours to finish and I wouldn't say it's especially deep. Checking out a gameplay video on YouTube would probably be wise to get a feel of it.

author: Gorilla Games

text: If you see this game on Steam cheap, I recommend it. There are a couple puzzles that are too obscure though. As for this theme, the composer actually came up with the melody while driving and recorded himself humming it. I added a link in the description (first 20 seconds or so) because I think it's funny, and because I do that myself quite a lot when composing music. The melody at 2:53 of my track Voyage is an example, I still have the recording!
author: SupraDarky

text: It's a good thing I like this theme because if I'm correct, this game only has 2 tracks. Legend of Grimrock reminded me why I loved playing old school dungeon RPGs back in the day. There's a big lack of those kind of games now and Grimrock is a big success. Super addictive, I found myself thinking about this game a lot when I wasn't playing it, I wanted to get back into its dark labyrinth, solve its puzzles and battle its monsters. The combat took a bit of time to get used to, I'll admit.
author: SupraDarky
